sentences.english: The shore diminishes 3 to 4 cm each year: it's hopeless, " says the scientist.
sentences.chinese: 海岸每年缩减3至4厘米，已经没救了”。

sentences.english: I think that we have been not enough great , he has not saved therefore.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们不够伟大，所以他没救了。

sentences.english: Don't take on, and fret about it too much! it can't be helped.
sentences.chinese: 别难过，别为这事太烦恼啦，没救了。
那么，媒体业是否就没救了呢？

sentences.english: I can hear the paramedic say, This girl is going to die.
sentences.chinese: 我听见医生说，这个女孩没救了。

sentences.english: You are helpless. Natural? You men are still only infatuated with the looks.
sentences.chinese: 真是没救了。天然的？你们男人只痴迷于外表。

sentences.english: My turtle fell behind a radiator and was not discovered until too late.
sentences.chinese: 我的龟掉到一个散热器的后面，发现时已经没救了。

sentences.english: Many would have said this was a marriage without hope.
sentences.chinese: 许多人说，这段婚姻没救了。

sentences.english: But that doesn't mean I'm not healed .
sentences.chinese: 但这并不意味着我没救了。

definition: see 無可救藥|无可救药[wu2 ke3 jiu4 yao4]
lit. the disease has attacked the vitals (idiom); fig. beyond cure/the situation is hopeless
lit. no antidote is possible (idiom); incurable/incorrigible/beyond redemption
stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
euphemistic equivalent of 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
